verses.roman:
rājā kahe, "kauḍi chāḍimu,--ihā nā kahibā
sahaje mora priya tā'rā,--ihā jānāibā

synonyms: rājā kahe—the King said; kauḍi chāḍimu—I shall excuse all the dues; ihā—this; nā kahibā—do not speak; sahaje—naturally; mora priya—my dear friends; tā'rā—they; ihā—this; jānāibā—let Him know.
translation: The King said, "I shall absolve Gopīnātha Paṭṭanāyaka of all his debts, but don't speak of this to the Lord. Simply let Him know that all the family members of Bhavānanda Rāya and Gopīnātha Paṭṭanāyaka are naturally my dear friends.
